message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.PF 

This paper deals with the problem of optimizing the placement and allocation of virtual network functions in order to maximize the amount of traffic that can be serviced through NFV. This problem is relevant to several areas of computer science, including network infrastructure (cs.NI), distributed computing (cs.DC), systems and control (cs.SI), information theory (cs.IT), and performance analysis (cs.PF). Given the focus on network function virtualization and traffic optimization, cs.NI is the most likely category. However, the paper also deals with optimization and approximation algorithms, which are relevant to several other categories.
